required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Quality of Life Study of Aflibercept in Patients With Metastatic Colorectal Cancer Previously Treated With an Oxaliplatin-Based Regimen
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Single Arm, Open Label Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Health-Related Quality of Life of Aflibercept in Patients With Metastatic Colorectal Cancer (mCRC) Previously Treated With an Oxaliplatin-Containing Regimen

brief_summary.textblock:
Primary Objective:
To provide metastatic colorectal cancer participants with access to aflibercept and to document the overall safety in these participants
Secondary Objective:
To document the Health-Related Quality of Life of aflibercept in this participants population

detailed_description.textblock: Each participants will be treated until disease progression, unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal for further treatment (whichever comes first). Participants were followed-up during study treatment and for at least 30 days after last administration.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received investigational medicinal product (IMP) was considered an adverse event (AE) without regard to possibility of causal relationship with this treatment. A serious AE (SAE): Any untoward medical occurrence that resulted in any of the following outcomes: death, life-threatening, required initial or prolonged in-patient hospitalization, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, congenital anomaly/birth defect, or considered as medically important event. Any TEAE included participants with both serious and non-serious AEs. National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria (NCI-CTCAE) Version 4.03 was used to assess severity (Grade 1=mild, Grade 2= moderate, Grade 3= severe, Grade 4= life-threatening/disabling) of AEs.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Hematological Parameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Abnormal hematological parameters included: anaemia, thrombocytopenia, leukopenia and neutropenia. Number of participants with each of these parameters were analyzed by grades (All Grades and Grades 3-4 as per NCI CTCAE (Version 4.03), where Grade 1=mild, Grade 2= moderate, Grade 3= severe, Grade 4= life-threatening/disabling. All Grades included Grades 1-4.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With International Normalized Ratio (INR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: The INR is a derived measure of the prothrombin time. The INR is the ratio of a participant's prothrombin time to a normal control sample. Normal range (without anti coagulation therapy): 0.8-1.2; Targeted range (with anti coagulation therapy) 2.0-3.0.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Electrolytes Parameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Abnormal electrolytes parameters included: hyponatremia, hypernatremia, hypocalcemia, hypercalcemia, hypokalemia, and hyperkalemia. Number of participants with each of these parameters were analyzed by grades ( All Grades and Grades 3-4 as per NCI CTCAE Version 4.03, where Grade 1=mild, Grade 2= moderate, Grade 3= severe, Grade 4= life-threatening/disabling. All Grades included Grades 1-4.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Renal and Liver Function Parameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Renal and liver function parameters included: creatinine, hyperbilirubinemia, aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and alkaline phosphatase. Number of participants with each of these parameters were analyzed by grades (All Grades and Grades 3-4) as per NCI CTCAE version 4.03, where Grade 1=mild, Grade 2= moderate, Grade 3= severe, Grade 4= life-threatening/disabling. All Grades included Grades 1-4.

primary_outcome.measure: Creatinine Clearance of Aflibercept Plus FOLFIRI
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Creatinine clearance is a measure of kidney function. Creatinine clearance rate is the volume of blood plasma that is cleared of creatinine by the kidneys per unit time. Creatinine clearance can be measured directly or estimated using established formulas. For this study, the creatinine clearance was calculated using the Cockroft-Gault or Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Other Abnormal Biochemistry Parameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Other abnormal biochemistry parameters included: hypoglycemia, hyperglycemia and hypoalbuminemia. Number of participants with each of these parameters were analyzed by grades (All Grades and Grades 3-4) as per NCI CTCAE Version 4.03, where Grade 1= mild, Grade 2= moderate, Grade 3= severe, Grade 4= life-threatening/disabling. All Grades included Grades 1-4.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Non-Gradable Biochemistry Parameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Non-gradeable biochemistry parameters included; chloride, urea, total protein, blood urea nitrogen (BUN) and lactate dehydrogenase (LDH). Number of participants with <lower limit of normal ranges (LLN) and >upper limit of normal ranges (ULN) for each of these parameters were reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Proteinuria Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Proteinuria is defined as the ratio of protein to creatinine. Number of participants with proteinuria were analyzed by grades (Grades 1, 2, 3 ,4) as per NCI CTCAE Version 4.03 where Grade 1= mild, Grade 2= moderate, Grade 3= severe, Grade 4= life-threatening/disabling.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Proteinuria Grade >=2
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Proteinuria is defined as the ratio of protein to creatinine. Number of participants with proteinuria grade >=2 (graded as per NCI CTCAE Version 4.03), where Grade>=2 represents moderate to life-threatening/disabling event.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Urinary Protein-Creatinine Ratio (UPCR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Urinary protein creatinine ratio (UPCR) corresponds to the ratio of the urinary protein and urinary creatinine concentration (expressed in mg/dL). This ratio provides an accurate quantification of 24-hours urinary protein excretion. There is a high correlation between morning UPCR and 24-hour proteinuria in participants with normal or reduced renal functions. Normal ratio is < or = 1.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Proteinuria (Grade>=2) Concomitant With Hematuria and /or Hypertension
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Proteinuria is defined as the presence of excess proteins in the urine (assessed either by spot sample, dipstick/ urine protein or 24 hour urine collection). Hematuria is defined as the presence of blood in urine (positive dipstick for RBC or reported AE). Number of participants with proteinuria grade >=2 (graded as per NCI CTCAE Version 4.03), where Grade>=2 represents moderate to life-threatening/disabling event. Hypertension (high blood pressure) is defined as having a blood pressure reading of more than 140/90 mmHg over a number of weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Cycle Delay and/or Dose Modification
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: A theoretical cycle is a 2 week period i.e. 14 days. A cycle is delayed if duration of previous cycle is greater than 14+2 days ; dose modification includes dose reduction and dose omission.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Health Related Quality of Life (HRQL) European Organization for Research and Treatment for Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire Core 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30 Score): Global Health Status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose at Baseline, Day 1 of every odd cycle (from Cycle 3 to 35); at the end of treatment (EOT) (within 30 days of last treatment) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: EORTC-QLQ-C30 is a cancer-specific instrument with 30 questions for evaluation of new chemotherapy and provides an assessment of participant reported outcome dimensions. First 28 questions used 4-point scale (1=not at all,2=a little,3=quite a bit,4=very much) for evaluating 5 functional scales (physical,role,emotional,cognitive,social), 3 symptom scales (fatigue,nausea/vomiting,pain) & other single items. For each item,high score represented high level of symptomatology/problem. Last 2 questions represented participant's assessment of overall health & quality of life, coded on 7-point scale (1=very poor to 7=excellent).EORTC QLQ-C30 observed values and change from baseline for global health status (scoring of questions 29 & 30) and 5 functional scales, 3 symptom scales and other single items (scoring of questions 1 to 28). Answers were converted into grading scale, with values between 0 and 100. A high score represented a favourable outcome with a best quality of life for participant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in HRQL EORTC QLQ-C30 Score: Functional Scales
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose at Baseline, Day 1 of every odd cycle (from Cycle 3 to 35); at EOT (within 30 days of last treatment) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: EORTC-QLQ-C30 is a cancer-specific instrument with 30 questions for evaluation of new chemotherapy and provides an assessment of participant reported outcome dimensions. First 28 questions used 4-point scale (1=not at all,2=a little,3=quite a bit,4=very much) for evaluating 5 functional scales (physical,role,emotional,cognitive,social), 3 symptom scales (fatigue,nausea/vomiting,pain) & other single items. For each item,high score represented high level of symptomatology/problem. Last 2 questions represented participant's assessment of overall health & quality of life, coded on 7-point scale (1=very poor to 7=excellent). EORTC QLQ-C30 observed values and change from baseline for global health status (scoring of questions 29 & 30) and 5 functional scales, 3 symptom scales and other single items (scoring of questions 1 to 28).Answers were converted into grading scale, with values between 0 and 100. A high score represented a favourable outcome with a best quality of life for participant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HRQL EORTC QLQ-C30 Score: Symptom Scales
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose at Baseline, Day 1 of every odd cycle (from Cycle 3 to 35); at EOT (within 30 days of last treatment) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: EORTC-QLQ-C30 is a cancer-specific instrument with 30 questions for evaluation of new chemotherapy and provides an assessment of participant reported outcome dimensions. First 28 questions used 4-point scale (1=not at all,2=a little,3=quite a bit,4=very much) for evaluating 5 functional scales (physical,role,emotional,cognitive,social), 3 symptom scales (fatigue,nausea/vomiting,pain) & other single items. For each item,high score represented high level of symptomatology/problem. Last 2 questions represented participant's assessment of overall health & quality of life, coded on 7-point scale (1=very poor to 7=excellent). EORTC QLQ-C30 observed values and change from baseline for global health status (scoring of questions 29 & 30) and 5 functional scales, 3 symptom scales and other single items (scoring of questions 1 to 28). Answers were converted into grading scale, with values between 0 and 100. A high score represented a favorable outcome with a best quality of life for participant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HRQL EQ-5D-3L Quality of Life: Single Index Utility Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose at Baseline, Day 1 of every odd cycle (from Cycle 3 to 35); at EOT (within 30 days of last treatment) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D was a standardized HRQL questionnaire consisting of EQ-5D descriptive system and Visual Analogue Scale (VAS). EQ-5D descriptive system comprised of 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression measured on 3 levels (no problem, some problems & severe problems) within a particular EQ-5D dimension. 5 dimensional 3-level system was converted into single index utility score. Possible values for single index utility score ranged from -0.594 (severe problems in all dimensions) to 1.0 (no problem in all dimensions) on scale where 1 represented best possible health state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HRQL EQ-5D-3L VAS Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose at Baseline, Day 1 of every odd cycle (from Cycle 3 to 35); at EOT (within 30 days of last treatment) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D was a standardized HRQL questionnaire consisting of EQ-5D descriptive system and VAS. EQ-5D descriptive system comprised of 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression measured on 3 levels (no problem, some problems & severe problems) within a particular EQ-5D dimension. 5 dimensional 3-level system was converted into single index utility score. The VAS recorded the respondent's self-rated health on a vertical visual analogue scale. The VAS 'thermometer' has endpoints of 100 (Best imaginable health state) at the top and 0 (Worst imaginable health state) at the bottom. This information can be used as a quantitative measure of health outcome as judged by the individual respondents.

arm_group.description: Aflibercept 4 mg/kg IV infusion over 60 minutes followed by Irinotecan 180 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 90 minutes and Leucovorin 400 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 120 minutes at the same time followed by 5-Fluorouracil (5-FU) 400 mg/m^2 IV bolus over 2-4 minutes followed by 5-FU 2400 mg/m^2 continuous IV infusion over 46 hours on Day 1 of each cycle (1 Cycle = 2 weeks), until disease progression (DP), unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal of further treatment.

intervention.description: Pharmaceutical form:Concentrate for solution for infusion Route of administration: Intravenous

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria :
- Histologically or cytologically proven adenocarcinoma of the colon or rectum.
- Metastatic disease.
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status 0-1.
- One and only one prior chemotherapeutic regimen for metastatic disease. This prior chemotherapy was an oxaliplatin containing regimen. Participants must had progressed during or after the oxaliplatin based chemotherapy. Participants relapsed within 6 months of completion of oxaliplatin adjuvant chemotherapy were eligible.
- Signed written informed consent obtained prior to inclusion.
Exclusion criteria:
- Prior therapy with irinotecan.
- Inadequate bone marrow, liver and renal function: neutrophils < 1.5x109/L, platelets < 100x109/L, hemoglobin < 9.0 g/dL, total bilirubin >1.5 x upper normal limit (ULN), transaminases >3 x ULN (unless liver metastasis are present), alkaline phosphatase >3 x ULN (unless liver metastasis are present), serum creatinine > 1.5 x ULN.
- Less than 4 weeks from prior radiotherapy, prior chemotherapy, prior major surgery (or until the surgical wound were fully healed).
- Treatment with any investigational drug within the prior 30 days.
- Treatment with concomitant anticonvulsivant agents that were CYP3A4 inducers (phenytoin, phenobarbital, carbamazepine), unless discontinued >7 days.
- History of brain metastases, uncontrolled spinal cord compression, or carcinomatous meningitis or new evidence of brain or leptomeningeal disease.
- Prior malignancy (other than colorectal) including prior malignancy from which the participants had been disease free for < 5 years (except adequately treated basal or squamous cell skin cancer or carcinoma in situ of the cervix).
- Any of the following within 6 months prior to study inclusion: myocardial infarction, severe/unstable angina pectoris, coronary/peripheral artery bypass graft, severe congestive heart failure, stroke or transient ischemic attack.
- Any of the following within 3 months prior study inclusion: severe gastrointestinal bleeding/hemorrhage, treatment resistant peptic ulcer disease, erosive oesophagitis or gastritis, infectious or inflammatory bowel disease, diverticulitis, pulmonary embolism or other uncontrolled thromboembolic event.
- Occurrence of deep vein thrombosis within 4 weeks, prior to study inclusion.
- Known acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS-related illnesses) or known HIV disease requiring antiretroviral treatment.
- Known dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase deficiency.
- Predisposing colonic or small bowel disorders in which the symptoms were uncontrolled.
- Prior history of chronic enteropathy, inflammatory enteropathy, chronic diarrhea, unresolved bowel obstruction/sub-obstruction, more than hemicolectomy, extensive small intestine resection with chronic diarrhea.
- Known Gilbert's syndrome.
- Unresolved or unstable toxicity from any prior anti cancer therapy at the time of inclusion.
- History of anaphylaxis or known intolerance to atropine sulphate or loperamide or appropriate antiemetics to be administered in conjunction with FOLFIRI (irinotecan, 5-Fluorouracil, leucovorin).
- Severe acute or chronic medical condition, which could impair the ability of the participants to participate to the study.
- Urine protein-creatinine ratio (UPCR) >1 on morning spot urinalysis or proteinuria > 500 mg/24-h.
- Uncontrolled hypertension within 3 months prior to study inclusion.
- Participants on anticoagulant therapy with unstable dose of warfarin and/or had an out-of-therapeutic range INR within the 4 weeks prior to study inclusion.
- Evidence of clinically significant bleeding predisposition or underlying coagulopathy, non-healing wound.
- Pregnant or breast-feeding women.
- Participants with reproductive potential who were not agree to use an accepted effective method of contraception.
The above information wass not intended to contain all considerations relevant to a participant's potential participation in a clinical trial.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 151 sites in 23 countries. A total of 798 participants were screened between 30 May 2012 and 03 January 2015, out of which 781 participants were enrolled and 779 participants were treated.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants enrolled in the study to assess the safety of Aflibercept in participants treated with a combination of Aflibercept with FOLFIRI regimen (Irinotecan, Leucovorin and 5-Fluorouracil [5-FU]).

group.title: Aflibercept + FOLFIRI (Irinotecan, 5-FU & Leucovorin)
group.description: Aflibercept 4 mg/kg intravenous (IV) infusion over 60 minutes followed by Irinotecan 180 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 90 minutes and Leucovorin 400 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 120 minutes at the same time followed by 5-FU 400 mg/m^2 IV bolus over 2-4 minutes followed by 5-FU 2400 mg/m^2 continuous IV infusion over 46 hours on Day 1 of each cycle (1 Cycle = 2 weeks), until disease progression (DP), unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal of further treatment.

participants_list.participants: 403 participants with DP and 209 with adverse events were considered as completed.

baseline.population: Safety population defined as the participants who signed the informed consent form and received at least part of one dose of study treatment.

group.title: Aflibercept + FOLFIRI (Irinotecan, 5-FU & Leucovorin)
group.description: Aflibercept 4 mg/kg IV infusion over 60 minutes followed by Irinotecan 180 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 90 minutes and Leucovorin 400 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 120 minutes at the same time followed by 5-FU 400 mg/m^2 IV bolus over 2-4 minutes followed by 5-FU 2400 mg/m^2 continuous IV infusion over 46 hours on Day 1 of each cycle (1 Cycle = 2 weeks), until DP, unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal of further treatment.

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Body Surface Area (BSA)
Systolic Blood Pressure
measure.population: Number of participants analyzed = participants with available data for specified measure.

measure.title: Diastolic Blood Pressure
measure.population: Number of participants analyzed = participants with available data for specified measure.

measure.title: Any Relevant Medical/Surgical History
measure.description: Any relevant medical/surgical history including detailed cardiovascular risk factors and prior vascular events if any.

measure.title: History of Thrombovascular Event and/or Presence of Cardiovascular Risk Factor
Time From Initial Histological Diagnosis till Baseline Visit
Location of Primary Tumor
Histology
Organs with Metastases at Baseline
Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status (ECOG PS)
measure.description: ECOG PS is used to assess how the disease affects the daily living abilities of the participant. It ranges on the scale from 0-5 (0= normal activity; 1= symptoms but ambulatory; 2= in bed for less than (<) 50 percent (%) of the time; 3= in bed for greater than (>) 50% of the time; 4= 100% bedridden; 5= dead.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
outcome.description: Any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received investigational medicinal product (IMP) was considered an adverse event (AE) without regard to possibility of causal relationship with this treatment. A serious AE (SAE): Any untoward medical occurrence that resulted in any of the following outcomes: death, life-threatening, required initial or prolonged in-patient hospitalization, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, congenital anomaly/birth defect, or considered as medically important event. Any TEAE included participants with both serious and non-serious AEs. National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria (NCI-CTCAE) Version 4.03 was used to assess severity (Grade 1=mild, Grade 2= moderate, Grade 3= severe, Grade 4= life-threatening/disabling) of AEs.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
outcome.population: Safety population defined as the participants who signed the informed consent form and received at least part of one dose of study treatment.

group.title: Aflibercept + FOLFIRI (Irinotecan, 5-FU & Leucovorin)
group.description: Aflibercept 4 mg/kg IV infusion over 60 minutes followed by Irinotecan 180 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 90 minutes and Leucovorin 400 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 120 minutes at the same time followed by 5-FU 400 mg/m^2 IV bolus over 2-4 minutes followed by 5-FU 2400 mg/m^2 continuous IV infusion over 46 hours on Day 1 of each cycle (1 Cycle = 2 weeks), until DP, unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal of further treatment.

outcome.population: Safety population. Here, 'Number Analyzed' = participants with available data for specified categories.

group.title: Aflibercept + FOLFIRI (Irinotecan, 5-FU & Leucovorin)
group.description: Aflibercept 4 mg/kg IV infusion over 60 minutes followed by Irinotecan 180 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 90 minutes and Leucovorin 400 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 120 minutes at the same time followed by 5-FU 400 mg/m^2 IV bolus over 2-4 minutes followed by 5-FU 2400 mg/m^2 continuous IV infusion over 46 hours on Day 1 of each cycle (1 Cycle = 2 weeks), until DP, unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal of further treatment.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Renal and Liver Function Parameters
measure.description: Renal and liver function parameters included: creatinine, hyperbilirubinemia, aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and alkaline phosphatase. Number of participants with each of these parameters were analyzed by grades (All Grades and Grades 3-4) as per NCI CTCAE version 4.03, where Grade 1=mild, Grade 2= moderate, Grade 3= severe, Grade 4= life-threatening/disabling. All Grades included Grades 1-4.
measure.population: Safety population. Here, 'Number Analyzed' = participants with available data for specified categories.

outcome.title: Creatinine Clearance of Aflibercept Plus FOLFIRI
outcome.description: Creatinine clearance is a measure of kidney function. Creatinine clearance rate is the volume of blood plasma that is cleared of creatinine by the kidneys per unit time. Creatinine clearance can be measured directly or estimated using established formulas. For this study, the creatinine clearance was calculated using the Cockroft-Gault or Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
outcome.population: Safety population. Overall number of participants analyzed = participants evaluable for this outcome measure.

group.title: Aflibercept + FOLFIRI (Irinotecan, 5-FU & Leucovorin)
group.description: Aflibercept 4 mg/kg IV infusion over 60 minutes followed by Irinotecan 180 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 90 minutes and Leucovorin 400 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 120 minutes at the same time followed by 5-FU 400 mg/m^2 IV bolus over 2-4 minutes followed by 5-FU 2400 mg/m^2 continuous IV infusion over 46 hours on Day 1 of each cycle (1 Cycle = 2 weeks), until DP, unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal of further treatment.

measure.title: Creatinine Clearance of Aflibercept Plus FOLFIRI
measure.description: Creatinine clearance is a measure of kidney function. Creatinine clearance rate is the volume of blood plasma that is cleared of creatinine by the kidneys per unit time. Creatinine clearance can be measured directly or estimated using established formulas. For this study, the creatinine clearance was calculated using the Cockroft-Gault or Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD).
measure.population: Safety population. Overall number of participants analyzed = participants evaluable for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Other Abnormal Biochemistry Parameters
outcome.description: Other abnormal biochemistry parameters included: hypoglycemia, hyperglycemia and hypoalbuminemia. Number of participants with each of these parameters were analyzed by grades (All Grades and Grades 3-4) as per NCI CTCAE Version 4.03, where Grade 1= mild, Grade 2= moderate, Grade 3= severe, Grade 4= life-threatening/disabling. All Grades included Grades 1-4.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
outcome.population: Safety population. Here, 'Number Analyzed' = participants with available data for specified categories.

group.title: Aflibercept + FOLFIRI (Irinotecan, 5-FU & Leucovorin)
group.description: Aflibercept 4 mg/kg IV infusion over 60 minutes followed by Irinotecan 180 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 90 minutes and Leucovorin 400 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 120 minutes at the same time followed by 5-FU 400 mg/m^2 IV bolus over 2-4 minutes followed by 5-FU 2400 mg/m^2 continuous IV infusion over 46 hours on Day 1 of each cycle (1 Cycle = 2 weeks), until DP, unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal of further treatment.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Other Abnormal Biochemistry Parameters
measure.description: Other abnormal biochemistry parameters included: hypoglycemia, hyperglycemia and hypoalbuminemia. Number of participants with each of these parameters were analyzed by grades (All Grades and Grades 3-4) as per NCI CTCAE Version 4.03, where Grade 1= mild, Grade 2= moderate, Grade 3= severe, Grade 4= life-threatening/disabling. All Grades included Grades 1-4.
measure.population: Safety population. Here, 'Number Analyzed' = participants with available data for specified categories.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Non-Gradable Biochemistry Parameters
outcome.description: Non-gradeable biochemistry parameters included; chloride, urea, total protein, blood urea nitrogen (BUN) and lactate dehydrogenase (LDH). Number of participants with <lower limit of normal ranges (LLN) and >upper limit of normal ranges (ULN) for each of these parameters were reported.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
outcome.population: Safety population. Here, 'Number Analyzed = participants with available data for specified categories.

group.title: Aflibercept + FOLFIRI (Irinotecan, 5-FU & Leucovorin)
group.description: Aflibercept 4 mg/kg IV infusion over 60 minutes followed by Irinotecan 180 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 90 minutes and Leucovorin 400 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 120 minutes at the same time followed by 5-FU 400 mg/m^2 IV bolus over 2-4 minutes followed by 5-FU 2400 mg/m^2 continuous IV infusion over 46 hours on Day 1 of each cycle (1 Cycle = 2 weeks), until DP, unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal of further treatment.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Non-Gradable Biochemistry Parameters
measure.description: Non-gradeable biochemistry parameters included; chloride, urea, total protein, blood urea nitrogen (BUN) and lactate dehydrogenase (LDH). Number of participants with <lower limit of normal ranges (LLN) and >upper limit of normal ranges (ULN) for each of these parameters were reported.
measure.population: Safety population. Here, 'Number Analyzed = participants with available data for specified categories.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Proteinuria Events
outcome.description: Proteinuria is defined as the ratio of protein to creatinine. Number of participants with proteinuria were analyzed by grades (Grades 1, 2, 3 ,4) as per NCI CTCAE Version 4.03 where Grade 1= mild, Grade 2= moderate, Grade 3= severe, Grade 4= life-threatening/disabling.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)

group.title: Aflibercept + FOLFIRI (Irinotecan, 5-FU & Leucovorin)
group.description: Aflibercept 4 mg/kg IV infusion over 60 minutes followed by Irinotecan 180 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 90 minutes and Leucovorin 400 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 120 minutes at the same time followed by 5-FU 400 mg/m^2 IV bolus over 2-4 minutes followed by 5-FU 2400 mg/m^2 continuous IV infusion over 46 hours on Day 1 of each cycle (1 Cycle = 2 weeks), until DP, unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal of further treatment.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Proteinuria Events
measure.description: Proteinuria is defined as the ratio of protein to creatinine. Number of participants with proteinuria were analyzed by grades (Grades 1, 2, 3 ,4) as per NCI CTCAE Version 4.03 where Grade 1= mild, Grade 2= moderate, Grade 3= severe, Grade 4= life-threatening/disabling.
measure.population: Safety population.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Proteinuria Grade >=2
outcome.description: Proteinuria is defined as the ratio of protein to creatinine. Number of participants with proteinuria grade >=2 (graded as per NCI CTCAE Version 4.03), where Grade>=2 represents moderate to life-threatening/disabling event.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)

group.title: Aflibercept + FOLFIRI (Irinotecan, 5-FU & Leucovorin)
group.description: Aflibercept 4 mg/kg IV infusion over 60 minutes followed by Irinotecan 180 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 90 minutes and Leucovorin 400 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 120 minutes at the same time followed by 5-FU 400 mg/m^2 IV bolus over 2-4 minutes followed by 5-FU 2400 mg/m^2 continuous IV infusion over 46 hours on Day 1 of each cycle (1 Cycle = 2 weeks), until DP, unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal of further treatment.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Proteinuria Grade >=2
measure.description: Proteinuria is defined as the ratio of protein to creatinine. Number of participants with proteinuria grade >=2 (graded as per NCI CTCAE Version 4.03), where Grade>=2 represents moderate to life-threatening/disabling event.
measure.population: Safety population

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Urinary Protein-Creatinine Ratio (UPCR)
outcome.description: Urinary protein creatinine ratio (UPCR) corresponds to the ratio of the urinary protein and urinary creatinine concentration (expressed in mg/dL). This ratio provides an accurate quantification of 24-hours urinary protein excretion. There is a high correlation between morning UPCR and 24-hour proteinuria in participants with normal or reduced renal functions. Normal ratio is < or = 1.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
outcome.population: Safety population. Here, 'Number Analyzed = participants with available data for specified categories.

group.title: Aflibercept + FOLFIRI (Irinotecan, 5-FU & Leucovorin)
group.description: Aflibercept 4 mg/kg IV infusion over 60 minutes followed by Irinotecan 180 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 90 minutes and Leucovorin 400 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 120 minutes at the same time followed by 5-FU 400 mg/m^2 IV bolus over 2-4 minutes followed by 5-FU 2400 mg/m^2 continuous IV infusion over 46 hours on Day 1 of each cycle (1 Cycle = 2 weeks), until DP, unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal of further treatment.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Urinary Protein-Creatinine Ratio (UPCR)
measure.description: Urinary protein creatinine ratio (UPCR) corresponds to the ratio of the urinary protein and urinary creatinine concentration (expressed in mg/dL). This ratio provides an accurate quantification of 24-hours urinary protein excretion. There is a high correlation between morning UPCR and 24-hour proteinuria in participants with normal or reduced renal functions. Normal ratio is < or = 1.
measure.population: Safety population. Here, 'Number Analyzed = participants with available data for specified categories.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Proteinuria (Grade>=2) Concomitant With Hematuria and /or Hypertension
outcome.description: Proteinuria is defined as the presence of excess proteins in the urine (assessed either by spot sample, dipstick/ urine protein or 24 hour urine collection). Hematuria is defined as the presence of blood in urine (positive dipstick for RBC or reported AE). Number of participants with proteinuria grade >=2 (graded as per NCI CTCAE Version 4.03), where Grade>=2 represents moderate to life-threatening/disabling event. Hypertension (high blood pressure) is defined as having a blood pressure reading of more than 140/90 mmHg over a number of weeks.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)

group.title: Aflibercept + FOLFIRI (Irinotecan, 5-FU & Leucovorin)
group.description: Aflibercept 4 mg/kg IV infusion over 60 minutes followed by Irinotecan 180 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 90 minutes and Leucovorin 400 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 120 minutes at the same time followed by 5-FU 400 mg/m^2 IV bolus over 2-4 minutes followed by 5-FU 2400 mg/m^2 continuous IV infusion over 46 hours on Day 1 of each cycle (1 Cycle = 2 weeks), until DP, unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal of further treatment.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Proteinuria (Grade>=2) Concomitant With Hematuria and /or Hypertension
measure.description: Proteinuria is defined as the presence of excess proteins in the urine (assessed either by spot sample, dipstick/ urine protein or 24 hour urine collection). Hematuria is defined as the presence of blood in urine (positive dipstick for RBC or reported AE). Number of participants with proteinuria grade >=2 (graded as per NCI CTCAE Version 4.03), where Grade>=2 represents moderate to life-threatening/disabling event. Hypertension (high blood pressure) is defined as having a blood pressure reading of more than 140/90 mmHg over a number of weeks.
measure.population: Safety population.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Cycle Delay and/or Dose Modification
outcome.description: A theoretical cycle is a 2 week period i.e. 14 days. A cycle is delayed if duration of previous cycle is greater than 14+2 days ; dose modification includes dose reduction and dose omission.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after the last treatment administration (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI whichever comes last) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
outcome.population: Safety population defined as the participants who signed the informed consent form and received at least one dose of study treatment.

group.title: Aflibercept + FOLFIRI (Irinotecan, 5-FU & Leucovorin)
group.description: Aflibercept 4 mg/kg IV infusion over 60 minutes followed by Irinotecan 180 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 90 minutes and Leucovorin 400 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 120 minutes at the same time followed by 5-FU 400 mg/m^2 IV bolus over 2-4 minutes followed by 5-FU 2400 mg/m^2 continuous IV infusion over 46 hours on Day 1 of each cycle (1 Cycle = 2 weeks), until DP, unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal of further treatment.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Cycle Delay and/or Dose Modification
measure.description: A theoretical cycle is a 2 week period i.e. 14 days. A cycle is delayed if duration of previous cycle is greater than 14+2 days ; dose modification includes dose reduction and dose omission.
measure.population: Safety population defined as the participants who signed the informed consent form and received at least one dose of study treatment.

class.title: No delay and no dose modification
Delay and Aflibercept and Folfiri modified

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Health Related Quality of Life (HRQL) European Organization for Research and Treatment for Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire Core 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30 Score): Global Health Status
outcome.description: EORTC-QLQ-C30 is a cancer-specific instrument with 30 questions for evaluation of new chemotherapy and provides an assessment of participant reported outcome dimensions. First 28 questions used 4-point scale (1=not at all,2=a little,3=quite a bit,4=very much) for evaluating 5 functional scales (physical,role,emotional,cognitive,social), 3 symptom scales (fatigue,nausea/vomiting,pain) & other single items. For each item,high score represented high level of symptomatology/problem. Last 2 questions represented participant’s assessment of overall health & quality of life, coded on 7-point scale (1=very poor to 7=excellent).EORTC QLQ-C30 observed values and change from baseline for global health status (scoring of questions 29 & 30) and 5 functional scales, 3 symptom scales and other single items (scoring of questions 1 to 28). Answers were converted into grading scale, with values between 0 and 100. A high score represented a favourable outcome with a best quality of life for participant.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose at Baseline, Day 1 of every odd cycle (from Cycle 3 to 35); at the end of treatment (EOT) (within 30 days of last treatment) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
outcome.population: EORTC QLQ-C30 analysis population: participants who signed informed consent form; had an evaluable QLQ-C30 questionnaire at baseline and at least one evaluable assessment post baseline and received at least part of one dose of study treatment (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI). Here, 'Number Analyzed' = participants analyzed at specified timepoints.

group.title: Aflibercept + FOLFIRI (Irinotecan, 5-FU & Leucovorin)
group.description: Aflibercept 4 mg/kg IV infusion over 60 minutes followed by Irinotecan 180 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 90 minutes and Leucovorin 400 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 120 minutes at the same time followed by 5-FU 400 mg/m^2 IV bolus over 2-4 minutes followed by 5-FU 2400 mg/m^2 continuous IV infusion over 46 hours on Day 1 of each cycle (1 Cycle = 2 weeks), until DP, unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal of further treatment.

For each item,high score represented high level of symptomatology/problem. Last 2 questions represented participant’s assessment of overall health & quality of life, coded on 7-point scale (1=very poor to 7=excellent).EORTC QLQ-C30 observed values and change from baseline for global health status (scoring of questions 29 & 30) and 5 functional scales, 3 symptom scales and other single items (scoring of questions 1 to 28). Answers were converted into grading scale, with values between 0 and 100. A high score represented a favourable outcome with a best quality of life for participant.
measure.population: EORTC QLQ-C30 analysis population: participants who signed informed consent form; had an evaluable QLQ-C30 questionnaire at baseline and at least one evaluable assessment post baseline and received at least part of one dose of study treatment (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI). Here, 'Number Analyzed' = participants analyzed at specified timepoints.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in HRQL EQ-5D-3L Quality of Life: Single Index Utility Score
outcome.description: EQ-5D was a standardized HRQL questionnaire consisting of EQ-5D descriptive system and Visual Analogue Scale (VAS). EQ-5D descriptive system comprised of 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression measured on 3 levels (no problem, some problems & severe problems) within a particular EQ-5D dimension. 5 dimensional 3-level system was converted into single index utility score. Possible values for single index utility score ranged from -0.594 (severe problems in all dimensions) to 1.0 (no problem in all dimensions) on scale where 1 represented best possible health state.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose at Baseline, Day 1 of every odd cycle (from Cycle 3 to 35); at EOT (within 30 days of last treatment) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
outcome.population: EQ-5D analysis population: participants who signed informed consent form, had an evaluable EQ-5D questionnaire at baseline and at least one evaluable assessment post baseline and received at least part of one dose of study treatment (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI). Here, 'Number Analyzed' = participants analyzed at specified timepoints.

group.title: Aflibercept + FOLFIRI (Irinotecan, 5-FU & Leucovorin)
group.description: Aflibercept 4 mg/kg IV infusion over 60 minutes followed by Irinotecan 180 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 90 minutes and Leucovorin 400 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 120 minutes at the same time followed by 5-FU 400 mg/m^2 IV bolus over 2-4 minutes followed by 5-FU 2400 mg/m^2 continuous IV infusion over 46 hours on Day 1 of each cycle (1 Cycle = 2 weeks), until DP, unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal of further treatment.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in HRQL EQ-5D-3L Quality of Life: Single Index Utility Score
measure.description: EQ-5D was a standardized HRQL questionnaire consisting of EQ-5D descriptive system and Visual Analogue Scale (VAS). EQ-5D descriptive system comprised of 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression measured on 3 levels (no problem, some problems & severe problems) within a particular EQ-5D dimension. 5 dimensional 3-level system was converted into single index utility score. Possible values for single index utility score ranged from -0.594 (severe problems in all dimensions) to 1.0 (no problem in all dimensions) on scale where 1 represented best possible health state.
measure.population: EQ-5D analysis population: participants who signed informed consent form, had an evaluable EQ-5D questionnaire at baseline and at least one evaluable assessment post baseline and received at least part of one dose of study treatment (either Aflibercept or FOLFIRI). Here, 'Number Analyzed' = participants analyzed at specified timepoints.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in HRQL EQ-5D-3L VAS Score
outcome.description: EQ-5D was a standardized HRQL questionnaire consisting of EQ-5D descriptive system and VAS. EQ-5D descriptive system comprised of 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression measured on 3 levels (no problem, some problems & severe problems) within a particular EQ-5D dimension. 5 dimensional 3-level system was converted into single index utility score. The VAS recorded the respondent’s self-rated health on a vertical visual analogue scale. The VAS ‘thermometer’ has endpoints of 100 (Best imaginable health state) at the top and 0 (Worst imaginable health state) at the bottom. This information can be used as a quantitative measure of health outcome as judged by the individual respondents.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose at Baseline, Day 1 of every odd cycle (from Cycle 3 to 35); at EOT (within 30 days of last treatment) (maximum exposure: 214 weeks)
outcome.population: EQ-5D analysis population. Here, 'Number Analyzed' = participants analyzed at specified timepoints.

group.title: Aflibercept + FOLFIRI (Irinotecan, 5-FU & Leucovorin)
group.description: Aflibercept 4 mg/kg IV infusion over 60 minutes followed by Irinotecan 180 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 90 minutes and Leucovorin 400 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 120 minutes at the same time followed by 5-FU 400 mg/m^2 IV bolus over 2-4 minutes followed by 5-FU 2400 mg/m^2 continuous IV infusion over 46 hours on Day 1 of each cycle (1 Cycle = 2 weeks), until DP, unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal of further treatment.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in HRQL EQ-5D-3L VAS Score
measure.description: EQ-5D was a standardized HRQL questionnaire consisting of EQ-5D descriptive system and VAS. EQ-5D descriptive system comprised of 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression measured on 3 levels (no problem, some problems & severe problems) within a particular EQ-5D dimension. 5 dimensional 3-level system was converted into single index utility score. The VAS recorded the respondent’s self-rated health on a vertical visual analogue scale. The VAS ‘thermometer’ has endpoints of 100 (Best imaginable health state) at the top and 0 (Worst imaginable health state) at the bottom. This information can be used as a quantitative measure of health outcome as judged by the individual respondents.
measure.population: EQ-5D analysis population. Here, 'Number Analyzed' = participants analyzed at specified timepoints.

reported_events.time_frame: All AEs were collected from signature of the informed consent form up to the final visit (214 weeks) regardless of seriousness or relationship to investigational product.
reported_events.desc: Reported AEs and deaths are treatment-emergent that is AEs that developed/worsened and deaths that occurred during 'on-treatment period’ (from the first dose of treatment to 30 days after the last dose of treatment [either aflibercept or FOLFIRI]). Analysis was performed on safety population.

group.title: Aflibercept + FOLFIRI (Irinotecan, 5-FU & Leucovorin)
group.description: Aflibercept 4 mg/kg IV infusion over 60 minutes followed by Irinotecan 180 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 90 minutes and Leucovorin 400 mg/m^2 IV infusion over 120 minutes at the same time followed by 5-FU 400 mg/m^2 IV bolus over 2-4 minutes followed by 5-FU 2400 mg/m^2 continuous IV infusion over 46 hours on Day 1 of each cycle (1 Cycle = 2 weeks), until DP, unacceptable toxicity, death, Investigator's decision or participant's refusal of further treatment.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If no publication has occurred within 12 months of the completion of the study, the Investigator shall have the right to publish/present independently the results of the study. The Investigator shall provide the Sponsor with a copy of any such presentation/publication for comment at least 30 days before any presentation/submission for publication. If requested by the Sponsor, any presentation/submission shall be delayed up to 90 days, to allow the Sponsor to preserve its proprietary rights.
